snippet: The party of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi has backed down in a dispute over Myanmar's oath of office, agreeing to enter Parliament for the first time and reviving hopes for the country's reconciliation program. The pro-democracy leader and other newly...
abstract: The party of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi has backed down in a dispute over Myanmar's oath of office, agreeing to enter Parliament for the first time and reviving hopes for the country's reconciliation program. The pro-democracy leader and other newly elected lawmakers from the National League for Democracy will take their places in the ornate Parliament building on Wednesday, party officials said.

headline.main: Myanmar Opposition Yields in Dispute Over Oath of Office
